title: The First Ever Audible ACX Keyword Research Tool - Book Beam Tutorial

tactics.name: Audible Keyword Targeting
tactics.description: Use Book Beam's Audible-specific tool to identify high-potential keywords by analyzing search volume, competitor count, and ranking data directly from Audible.
steps: Filter for non-trademarked, specific long-tail keywords
Evaluate search volume, competitor count, and title density
Prioritize keywords with <100 competitors and >200 search volume

tactics.name: audible_keyword_analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keywords based on search volume and competition using Book Beam
steps: Check search volume thresholds (couple hundred or higher)
caveats: Tool limitations when search volume is too low
source_quotes: ided meditation for manifesting 112 is a little more on the lower side in terms of search uh volume so i would try and go for at least couple hundred or a little more in terms of search volume

heuristics.name: Competitor Density Rule
heuristics.condition: If competitor count is below 100, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: 'typically with audible we want around 100 books or less'

heuristics.name: low_review_boost
heuristics.condition: If search volume is below 200, prioritize keywords with fewer competitors
source_quotes: i would try and go for at least couple hundred or a little more in terms of search volume

claims.statement: Book Beam's Audible keyword tool provides data exclusively from Audible.com, not Amazon.com.
source_quotes: 'the data that you get is not coming from amazon.com'

claims.statement: Book Beam is the only tool that allows analyzing Audible-specific keywords
source_quotes: it is pretty much the only tool that allows you to analyze audible specific keywords

niche_patterns.description: Target niche keywords combining a general problem with a specific demographic to reduce competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrower keywords often have lower competitor counts and higher relevance
